programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: After a senator's daughter is kidnapped and held for ransom, the FBI must find the little girl before their time limit expires; they must dig into the senator's past for clues to who did this to his family.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: Maggie and OA hunt down a ruthless group of robbers who are posing as police officers to target armored trucks.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: Maggie and OA lead the search for an abducted former biological weapons chemist.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: The recently fired DEA Agent & Ex-Royal Canadian Mounted Police Officer, Nick Slaughter, moves to the Florida beach resort town of Key Mariah & opens a detective agency with a feisty local travel agent named Sylvie Girard! Their first case comes when an old friend of Nick's from the Philadelphia Police department asks them to help catch a killer!

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick Slaughter, a disgraced former Canadian Mountie, and DEA Agent moves to the tropical island paradise of Key Mariah. Once there he starts his own Private Detective Agency, and meets Sylvie Gerard, a local travel agent. Together they form a strong friendship and quite the detective team. However, the local police squad never make it easy for them luckily they have plenty of friends to help along the way. The Town of Key Mariah will never be the same again thanks to Nick Slaughter and company!

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick Slaughter, a disgraced former Canadian Mountie, and DEA Agent moves to the tropical island paradise of Key Mariah. Once there he starts his own Private Detective Agency, and meets Sylvie Gerard, a local travel agent. Together they form a strong friendship and quite the detective team. However, the local police squad never make it easy for them luckily they have plenty of friends to help along the way. The Town of Key Mariah will never be the same again thanks to Nick Slaughter and company!

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A man by the name of Mr. Minton hires Nick to locate his brother, Stuart, because their mother is dying. When Nick finds him, Stuart claims that he has no brother and his mother is already dead, leading Nick to discover that he's a member of the witness protection program and Mr. Milton is a hit man sent to take care of him.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A businessman is opening a casino with his shady partners. Sylvie Falls in love with him and leaves her detective partnership behind to work for him.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Today we are hopping down to South America to check out some of the coolest creatures on Earth. Animals featured include the parrot, the sea lion, the tapir, the iguana, and more!

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Did you know a beavers teeth never stop growing and that it can use them to build dams big enough to see from outer space? A flock of Canada geese can migrate 1500 miles in a single day. Plus, the Bison can move 40 mph!

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau looks at new ways of cultivating fresh, nutritious food. He visits a farm in Los Angeles where they grow food on a parking lot, just to show that fresh food can be grown in an urban environment. We also look into what distinguishes fruits from vegetables. The results can be surprising. And then we look at the amount of food that is wasted world wide.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: We head to a winter wonderland in Banff, Alberta, Canada. Philippe joins the avalanche safety team at Ski Lake Louise as they show a few different ways of avalanche control including dynamite blasts on the mountain. We then head to the Fairmont Chateau Lake Louise for a snowshoeing expedition. And finally we look at the dynamics of ice while climbing a frozen waterfall.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: We look at different examples of cultural science. Starting off in Hawaii, Philippe paddles out on a 6-man canoe during a lesson in early Hawaiian navigation. Then it's off to Florida to join members of the Seminole tribe who show us different uses of plants as tools and food in the harsh terrain of the everglades. We wrap things up in the Pacific Northwest looking at the Suquamish tribe.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: This week we head to the bright sunshine and clear waters of the Bahamas. Philippe will start off getting up close underwater with Great Hammerhead sharks. Then we join a professional freediver to get a look at the world's deepest saltwater blue hole. After that it's into the mangroves to see how local researchers have been tracking baby lemon sharks for decades.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Katsumoto's hearing date has arrived, and he will learn if his career in law enforcement is over for good or not; Magnum and Higgins are hired to investigate a man their client believes committed murder; Rick's suspicions grow on their relationship.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins investigate the robbery of an elderly man suffering from Alzheimer's; the ohana tries to help TC overcome a past trauma.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Rick make a shocking discovery in the Capt. Greene case; Higgins and TC head to Maui to help an eccentric billionaire find the owner of a pesky drone that has been harassing him; Shammy helps Kumu after an incident occurs at La Mariana.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins take on a case that sends Higgins inside a psychiatric hospital; Katsumoto and his son, Dennis, head to the mainland to look at colleges, but their trip takes a harrowing turn when a run-in with a local turns ugly.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: An armed hit team lays siege to Robin's Nest; TC is badly injured while Rick fights for his life.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins go to work for a dangerous and controversial client; Kumu and Shammy help move TC to a veterans' rehab facility; Rick flirts with a woman who works at the marina.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins try to help Zhao, a close friend of Kumu, recover her life savings that were all lost to a scammer; TC becomes increasingly frustrated at the lack of progress in his recovery and pushes everyone away.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins enlist Katsumoto to go under cover when a high-end restaurant chef goes missing; Kumu works with Cade at the cultural center, confronting America's dark chapter of the internment of Japanese Americans in the wake of Pearl Harbor.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Rick race to find a missing witness who can exonerate an innocent man accused of murder; TC tries to repair his relationship with Mahina after being released from the VA.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins are hired to find a missing gamer whose online friends believe he might be in trouble; Jin Jeong enlists the help of TC in a treasure hunt after his ex-partner gets out of prison.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins agree to help a teenage Amish boy who has traveled to Hawaii in search of his runaway sister; Rick sets out to find TC a date to the Marine Corps Ball.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: After a high-stakes homicide case falls apart at trial, Katsumoto asks Magnum to help him stop a killer from walking free; Higgins helps Jin Jeong with a mystery of his own.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins are hired by a University of Oahu dean to quietly investigate a professor who has been accused of having an inappropriate relationship with a female grad student; TC and Katsumoto take Cade and Dennis on a father-son camping trip.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins reexamine a fatal arson investigation at the request of TC and Mahina, leading to a sinister discovery; Kumu volunteers with Rick at a veterans' crisis call center.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins take a major step forward in their relationship; at the same time, the past comes back to haunt them when a previous suspect becomes their client; TC aims to scale up Island Hoppers; Rick gets a new business partner.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: A decorated former Navy SEAL returns home from Afghanistan and repurposes his military skills to become a private investigator in Hawaii.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A meek owner of a diamond and jewelry company hires Nick and Sylvie to find out if his hot, unhappy, and flirty wife is having an affair. Nick and Sylvie track her down only to witness her being murdered by her angry lover.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Ian, the owner of the small popular local beach bar Tropical Heat, and a close personal friend of Nick's, convinces Nick to help a pretty woman with amnesia who he just met. The more they find out about her past, the less she wants to remember.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick Slaughter, a disgraced former Canadian Mountie, and DEA Agent moves to the tropical island paradise of Key Mariah. Once there he starts his own Private Detective Agency, and meets Sylvie Gerard, a local travel agent. Together they form a strong friendship and quite the detective team. However, the local police squad never make it easy for them luckily they have plenty of friends to help along the way. The Town of Key Mariah will never be the same again thanks to Nick Slaughter and company!

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A strange woman hires Nick to stop her husband, who she believes is trying to murder her. However, Nick's investigation reveals evidence that leads him to believe she might be more psychotic than paranoid.

programme.title: Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye
programme.desc: Sue and the team receive information a "Dirty Bomb" has been smuggled into the country. The agents race against time in a desperate attempt to find it before it is detonated.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a mini-golf superstar; Brennan worries her father is returning to a life of crime; Wendell asks Hodgins to help restore his girlfriend's family heirloom.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Booth and Brennan go under cover into the world of underground poker to investigate the death of a high-stakes gambler -- putting Booth at risk of relapsing; Hodgins creates a new lab-related product; Booth and Brennan receive exciting news.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The team investigates when the remains of a celebrity chef are discovered at a local park; Booth and Brennan must question the staff at the Royal diner; Hodgins sells his invention for millions; Brennan teaches Christine about bones.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and Rollins must contend with the FBI and the Organized Crime bureau when a rape victim identifies a dangerous mobster as her assailant.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The SVU searches for a serial rapist who preys on mothers with young children; Benson and Fin struggle under the tightened reins of Chief McGrath.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The SVU faces the fury of social media fans when they arrest two popular influencer brothers.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Amaro asks the SVU for help in clearing a convicted man's name and brings a figure from Benson's past back into her life.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When a teenage sex worker disappears, Rollins and Velasco find a key clue in a pile of neglected missing persons reports.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Carisi asks the SVU for help with a murder investigation when one of the witnesses shows signs of abuse.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Carisi tries Richard Wheatley for the murder of Kathy Stabler; Benson finds herself at odds with a friend when Barba agrees to take the case.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The SVU is called in to help investigate a wave of hate crimes on Christmas Eve; Rollins catches up with an old flame.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A boy disappears after meeting up with an online gamer; Benson suspects her son is being bullied.

programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra heads to Evanston, IL to visit with Northwestern's Izzy Scane. Izzy has been a dominant force for the Wildcats since she first arrived on campus. With a National title, the Tewaaraton Award winner, and record shattering season – she has cemented herself as an all-time great. We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

programme.title: wsop-2024-be-ev-55-250k-nlh-shr-day2

programme.title: wsop-2024-be-ev-55-250k-nlh-shr-day3
programme.desc: Watch the final table of Event #55: $250,000 Super High Roller from the 2024 World Series of Poker.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker After Dark Holidays with Hellmuth Day 1
programme.desc: The first of three festive Poker After Dark nights headlined by Phil Hellmuth featured jolly $10000 Sit & Go! Rewatch the full show as Hellmuth took on Maria Ho Antonio Esfandiari Mike Matusow Dan Shak and Randall Emmett.

programme.title: Poker After Dark Holidays with Hellmuth Day 2
programme.desc: The festivities continue on Holidays with Hellmuth as Phil takes on all comers in this $100/$200 cash game. Rewatch the whole show now as he goes up against Dan Shak Brian Potashnik David 'Doc' Sands Avi Freedman and Rick Thompson.

programme.title: Poker Masters 2021 Episode 1
programme.desc: The 2021 Poker Masters is underway with Event #1 seeing seven players return and David Peters in control as the chip leader. Peters sits ahead of Brock Wilson, Shannon Shorr, Jonathan Jaffe, Dylan DeStefano, John Riordan, and Ben Yu as they play for the $205,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Sean Perry leads the Event #2 final table while John Riordan returns to sit at his second final table of the series. Also in contention are Jeremy Ausmus, Jake Schindler, Sam Soverel, and Daniel Negreanu as the final six play for the $206,400 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The game changes to Pot-Limit Omaha at the 2021 Poker Masters with Matthew Wantman holding the lead. Chris Brewer, Jake Daniels, Adam Hendrix, Brent Roberts, and Jake Schindler are all in the mix for the $186,300 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker After Dark
programme.desc: Take an intimate look at one table as it develops over a week of play. The world's best players come together to play a single-table tournament or cash game as your favorite players look to beat the best on Poker After Dark.

programme.desc: Former sheriff, Jim Courtright, runs a protection racket in 1880's Texas and takes drastic measures when men refuse to pay. Matt and Margaret arrive after a railroad man is killed.

programme.title: The Cheyenne Social Club
programme.desc: Cowboy John O'Hanlan (James Stewart) is surprised to learn that someone's left him a business in Cheyenne, Wyo. He sets out to claim it -- and is shocked to discover that it's a brothel. Madam Jenny (Shirley Jones), who runs the place, is dismayed when O'Hanlan wants to close it down, but his plans are derailed when he finds out that a local customer has beaten Jenny. He kills the man in a shootout, and then must protect himself and the girls from the dead man's vengeful clan.

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: Billy Clanton makes a pass at Lisa Carew, getting into a fight with her father, who has promised Lisa to Johnny Coster; Lisa runs away from her home.

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: A con man and his sister hatch a plan to distract Sheriff Hollister while they rob a bank.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: After the end of the Civil War, General Phil Sheridan, who has been appointed Governor of the New Mexico Territory, is on an inspection tour of the country.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A famous gunfighter marries and decides to retire. He and his wife settle down in North Fork and open a store, but three outlaws arrive in town looking to best him in a gunfight.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: An old friend of Lucas McCain's, a traveling photographer, comes to North Fork plying his trade. When a murder is committed, the photographer is accused of the crime.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: The townsfolk of North Fork decide to give a young couple a shivaree celebration. When the drunken crowd gets out of hand and roughs up the bride-to-be, the young groom challenges them.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Yancy investigates when several shopkeepers along Duquense Street pay twice as much for what their property is worth, & are subsequently robbed & murdered. He learns that a projected railroad spur is to be built to the waterfront through that shopping district and unscrupulous Northerners plan to use illegal means to grab all the available real estate before the project is officially announced.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Derringer is falsely accused of complicity in a waterfront property theft. Administer Colton manages to get Matthew Younger to drop the charges, but Yancy discovers the accuser may be throwing charges around to conceal the real perpetrators. His investigations lead him to a waterfront dive and its grave-robbing habitués.

programme.title: Bat Masterson
programme.desc: Bat learns a man calling himself Bat Masterson, wearing a derby and carrying a cane, has become the sheriff of Trinidad, Colo.

programme.title: Bat Masterson
programme.desc: Members of a gang confront Bat as he leads a trail drive, trying to get money from him before they'll let his cattle through town.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: When an inspector comes from New Orleans to arrest Ben Cartwright for a 20-year-old murder, Ben must withdraw from the Governor's race.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: When three army deserters escape imprisonment and enter the Ponderosa, Ben realizes what they've had to deal with and promises to protect them.

programme.title: Jeremiah Johnson
programme.desc: A Mexican-American War veteran, Jeremiah Johnson (Robert Redford), heads to the mountains to live in isolation. Woefully unequipped for the task at hand, Johnson is fortunate to come across a seasoned mountain man (Will Geer) willing to teach him the necessary survival tactics. As life continues in the mountains, Johnson finds himself a native bride (Delle Bolton) and an adopted son (Josh Albee). However, their peaceful existence is threatened when Johnson incurs the ire of the Crow Indians.

programme.title: Track of the Cat
programme.desc: Amid a harsh winter in northern California, the two eldest sons of a dysfunctional ranching family hunt a panther preying on their livestock.

programme.title: Cahill U.S. Marshal
programme.desc: A rugged U.S. marshal faces a difficult task when he discovers that his two neglected sons are involved in the bank robbery he is investigating.

programme.title: She Wore a Yellow Ribbon
programme.desc: The last job of Calvary Captain Nathan Brittles (John Wayne) before retirement is to soothe relations with the Cheyenne and Arapaho Indians after Custer's last stand. At the same time, he must transport the wife (Mildred Natwick) and niece (Joanne Dru) of his commanding officer to a safe destination. After both his missions stall, Brittles attempts a face-to-face meeting with an important Native American chief in order to stave off an impending war.

programme.desc: The Prince of Thieves executes a daring robbery in San Francisco.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Ten celebrities from the world of sport and television take on one of the most extreme obstacle courses.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Mesmerized by Bon Bon’s Belly Dancing, we catch up with our favourite Big Balls in the Qualifier. They dish out punishment to Australia’s very own female Jim Carrey and send Big Cat tamer Robbie into the pond. Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose “Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk” training comes into play.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In the season premiere episode, 40 of the best home cooks in America travel to Los Angeles to compete in the MASTERCHEF Battle of the Apron challenge, during which they will attempt to earn a coveted white apron and move forward to compete for the MASTERCHEF title, a cookbook deal and the $250,000 grand prize. Judging the battle rounds will be Ramsay and Tosi, who will taste for flavor, creativity and presentation. In order to move to the next round of the competition, the home cooks must display culinary skills, as well as an immense passion for food, and be determined to out-cook their rivals.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty plants out his tomatoes, continues work in his paradise garden, and reveals plans for a new project. In Peterborough, a city garden with a lack of space has not proved a problem for a couple who have created a woodland garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets involved in more seasonal tasks at Longmeadow. Carol Klein celebrates the spring highlights at Beth Chatto's Gardens in Essex, and Toby Buckland is in Cornwall to meet a gardener who fell out of love with gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels from the north west coast of Scotland to the north east coast of England, from historic reconstructions to modern re-inventions. He visits some of the most inhospitable places in the country and finds gardens that are flourishing.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across some of the country's landscapes, heading across the north of England to Northern Ireland. Here, Monty sees the ingenuity, passion and determination of British people to garden and create gardens, no matter what the canvas.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the middle of the country, from Wales to Norfolk. He comes across gardens for gnomes, much-loved, well-tended allotments and extravagant gardens that bankrupted their owners.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the most densely populated part of the country, London and the home counties. He visits some of London's gardens, including a special one on a barge, as well as a beautifully restored garden close to where he grew up in Hampshire.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the south west of the country to visit some of Britain's most exotic gardens. On this journey, Monty also goes to some of the country's most historic gardens, as well as some challenging contemporary ones.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's in the jewel garden showing which plants need protection from the elements now and which ones can be left until after the first frosts. He also plants out berried shrubs to help feed wildlife in the winter, harvests pumpkins and shows how to make use of fallen autumnal leaves.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his loofahs, plants tulip bulbs in pots, gives a masterclass in making leafmould and reflects on the gardening year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty turns his attention to the pond at Longmeadow. He adds a splash of colour to the planting with some perennial springtime favourites, as well as giving advice on pond maintenance which can be carried out without disturbing wildlife.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets going on a new project when he starts planting a colour-themed, fragrant border and he has tips on successional planting in the vegetable garden. Nick Bailey begins his ultimate guide to growing clematis, while Arit Anderson visits a new, free, public roof garden in London.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty turns his attention to the tender annuals he has grown from seed, including climbers and sunflowers and plants out beans for a bountiful summer harvest. Nick Bailey celebrates the rhododendron, one of the most colourful spring flowering shrubs.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team are out and about this week in Birmingham at the annual Gardeners' World Live show. Monty Don, Joe Swift and Adam Frost bring us design tips from the show gardens, Carol Klein seeks out the best plants in the floral marquee, Frances Tophill, Nick Bailey, Arit Anderson and Mark Lane look at inspirational planting ideas and the show helps visitors solve their gardening and planting problems.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty revels in the roses in his garden, harvests honey from his bees and gives advice on the maintenance of hardy geraniums as well as planting others for summer groundcover. Rachel de Thame shows how the most ordinary of spaces can be transformed by adding seasonal containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty tackles three seasons of gardening when he makes additions to his spring garden, gives advice on how to dry and preserve herbs for winter and plants up a container to give interest from now until spring. Carol celebrates one of the plant successes of an extraordinary summer, the Canna while Frances Tophill tackles a viewer's garden and suggests plants which will perform throughout the winter. Toby Buckland visits a garden in Devon with Japanese influences.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden, Monty is moving a rose which has outgrown its space and in the vegetable garden he gives advice on what to plant now for spring. He also finds out more about the mysterious world of earthworms and discovers why they are vital for the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings throughout the seasons. Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey in Cambridgeshire, a garden designed to look its best in winter.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the clocks going forward this weekend, there's an extra hour of gardening to enjoy. Monty makes the most of this as he begins to sow dahlia seeds for summer flowers, reveals a new project and shows what to plant now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his favourite winter veg, Joe Swift discovers AJ Odudu's passion for houseplants, and Sue Kent and Toby Buckland take an inspirational trip to Piet Oudolf's garden in Somerset.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings; Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey; Arit Anderson discovers how rewilding can increase biodiversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets involved in more seasonal tasks at Longmeadow. Carol Klein celebrates the spring highlights at Beth Chatto's Gardens in Essex, and Toby Buckland is in Cornwall to meet a gardener who fell out of love with gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team return with a celebration of spring. There's been plenty going on over the winter and lots of new projects in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential rose pruning, Monty plants clematis and rocket, cuts back grasses and makes a start on sowing annuals for colour this summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As plants begin to show their early growth, Monty gets plenty of plants for free when he demonstrates how to make the most of herbaceous perennials. He also cuts back pelargoniums that have overwintered in the greenhouse and makes a start on sowing vegetables. Nick Bailey shares plans for his new garden in Northamptonshire and shows how to create a container garden ideal for those on the move. Frances Tophill discovers more ways to use cut flowers as she visits a florist in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don grows a plant he's never tried before, loofahs. He also celebrates some of his favourite tulip combinations and plants out crocosmia. Joe Swift visits a garden, created by an award-winning designer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows how almost anything that holds soil and drains water can be used to grow seasonal veg, salad crops and herbs. Frances Tophill visits some hardy gardeners on the Isle of Man.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares the flowering borders for winter and makes a bonfire, Carol celebrates our berry-laden hedgerows, and Rachel visits Julian Clary in his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Canadian Whitetail
programme.desc: Taylor Partridge sets her sights of her Excalibur Crossbow on one VERY wide full velvet buck.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and a fellow guide search for redfish along the beach, but Mother Nature has other ideas and gives them a show they didn’t expect.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish she’s never caught before. Lo and behold, it’s a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: With Meredith McCord halfway around the world, Capt. Justin Leake gives show producer Chris Hermans his first shot at landing a tarpon after filming them for 9 seasons. Does art imitate life?

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: Ryan Miller targets exotic fish in Lake Ida with local guide Kevin Cannon in Episode 2 of FinQuest. Catching peacock bass and clown knife fish, Ryan also enjoys family fun with a skimboarding session in Jupiter, Florida.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve start the season with Capt Scott Stoky chasing Islamorada Tunas and Mahis offshore out of Plantation Boat Mart

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve catch a mixed bag bottom fishing off of Islamorada with Captain Scott Stoky.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve go yellow tailing out of Hawks Cay for a limit of tasty yellowtail snapper and Steve picks a battle with a big lemon shark.

programme.title: Into the Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve bounce around the reefs out of Hawks Cay catching a wide variety of reef dwellers.

programme.title: Into the Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve take their brand new Invincible 36’ out of Plantation Boat Mart to fly the kites for some early season sailfishing

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve make a big run from Plantation Boat Mart in the Invincible 36’into the green Gulf waters to fill the Yeti cooler and battle with some seas monsters.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike and Dallas King take advantage of a powerful summer tide, hooking into an all-out redfish frenzy where the action never slows down.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike navigates South Carolina’s breathtaking marsh, seizing a brief window when the seasonal high tide floods the grass, bringing incredible fishing.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Rex meets up with “Mr Crappie” Wally Marshall in Texas. Wally takes Rex to one of his secret spots to put the hammer on the crappie. Not only did they catch crappie, but nice largemouth and some top tier coppernose bluegill.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: The Southards continue their family tradition on Table Rock Lake. While they’re there, Trenton spends a day with “Mr. Worldwide” James Watson and learns some things from one of the best anglers on the lake.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The collaboration story between Winchester and Browning to create the groundbreaking 6.8 Western is featured. Tag along on a mule deer hunt in Utah with Chris Keefer and Winchester’s Jason Gilbertson, then follow Casey Keefer to Colorado for elk and Nebraska for whitetail where the 6.8 Western is put to the test.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The story of the game changing 350 Legend cartridge is documented at deer camps across the midwest with the Keefer Brothers in Kansas, Mark and Terry Drury in Missouri, Melissa Bachman in Nebraska and Team Winchester back in Missouri.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nobody chases the waterfowl migration as hard as Shawn Stahl of Team Winchester. The Michigan native spends over half of his year running the highways and flyways searching for the x. In this episode, we’ll tag along with Shawn and his crew with their Winchester pumps in hand as they hunker down hiding in fields and timber in hopes of locked wings from ducks and geese.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Huckberry's flagship adventure series is back in Japan and the DIRT crew is hungry as ever for adventure. This time, they’re diving into the Kansai region—where millennia-old traditions flow from the shore of Lake Biwa to surf breaks on the coast. Chef Coleman Griffin gives them a taste of the deep cultural immersion that inspires his culinary practice, from chef knives descended from samurai swords to fermented carp that went on to spawn sushi. And turns out, the perfect meal does exist, and the crew knew it as soon as they had a bite of their final omakase.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Guadalajara’s heritage runs deep. On the DIRT crew’s latest adventure, they explored the region’s rich history from volcanic highlands to secret surf coves. Chefs Xrysw Ruelas and Óscar Segundo sent Josh and co. to load up on locally grown coffee, spearfish between catching waves, and follow freshly harvested agave on its journey to becoming tequila. After learning the ropes of Mexico’s national sport, Charreria, and hitting up a Lucha Libre match, all the local flavors came together in a feast backed by thousands of years of tradition. There really is something special in the soil here.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: Lifelong cowboy and Oklahoma native Bill Parker is believed to be the 1st man to reach the shores of Normandy on D-day…June 6th 1944.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: Bill Hayes was at ground zero on September 11th, 2001. Now twenty years later, Bill recalls his time serving overseas in the military as well as a New York City Firefighter.

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: We researched all we could about fly fishing for grouper. Nothing came up. Normally a deep water fish, in Ozello Florida you can find gags in just a few feet of water, hiding in cracks waiting to ambush anything that swims overhead. Watch and see what we discovered. #fishingwithjay

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: Brandon "Eazy" Thompson is more than our local barber, he's an avid angler, hunter, and dedicated outdoorsman. He'd never fly-fished.....we decided to change that. #fishingwithjay

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: Over the past eight years, Mr. Trash Wheel and his fellow “trash interceptors” have gobbled up over 2,300 tons of trash in the Baltimore Harbor. Created by engineer and sailor John Kellet and loved by all, the trash wheels use renewable energy and are placed in strategic locations in the harbor – like river mouths – where the natural flow brings trash to them.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: At age seven, Cash “The Conservation Kid” Daniels began leading cleanups along the Tennessee River in his hometown, Chattanooga. Six years later, Cash continues to make a significant impact on the river’s health by strategically collecting fishing waste and inspiring his peers across the world to protect the environment and all the wildlife he holds dear.

programme.title: Dirty 30
programme.desc: Lake Fork, Texas. One of the most legendary big-bass lakes in the world—and one of the most humbling.In this episode of Dirty 30, everything I thought I knew got thrown out the window. Decades of experience? Didn’t matter. Past patterns? Useless. This one was all about adjusting on the fly, staying present, and grinding it out with one mantra in mind:Fish the Moment.When it got tough—when the bite shut down, when the pressure kicked in—there was only one thing left to do:Just Keep on Fishing.This is the raw, honest side of professional bass fishing. The mental battle. The stubborn faith. The relentless grind that separates the good days from the unforgettable ones.Watch as I dig deep on Lake Fork, fight through adversity, and chase greatness the only way I know how—cast by cast.Welcome to Dirty 30. Let’s go.Dirty 30 is a groundbreaking docu-series filmed, edited, and directed by Eric Guarino.In this episode, we follow Mike Iaconelli to the 2025 Progressive Bassmaster Elite Series at the Pasquotank River! As the camera rolls, we dive deep into the fishing world, shedding light on the industry and exploring the untold stories from Ike’s incredible 30-year career on the road.From behind-the-scenes moments to raw, unfiltered insights, this episode peels back the curtain on what it really takes to thrive in professional fishing. Get ready for some dirt, real talk, BIG FISH, and an up-close look at one of the sport’s most legendary figures.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: A remnant of the last Ice Age, the musk ox is almost mythical in appearance. For the people who share the Barren Ground region of Canada with them, they are an integral part of their culture. Show host, Dan Cabela, participates in a scientific sampling project to monitor the population's health, and get first-hand experience of the relationship between local people and this arctic icon.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: In this episode, Chef Jay Ducote brings along a very special fishing buddy, his dad, for our first-ever Catch & Cook freshwater adventure! We’re heading to the legendary Toledo Bend, famous for its sac-a-lait (Cajun for crappie) and ranked among the top bass lakes in the U.S. It’s a bucket-list stop for anglers everywhere, but trust us, the story doesn’t end with the fish.Steeped in Spanish, French, and Native American roots dating back to the Louisiana Purchase, this region serves up culture and flavor as rich as its fishing. We’ll be staying at Wildwood Resort, hitting the water with Captain Matt Loetscher of Living The Dream Guide Service, and capping off the day with spectacular lake views from their breezy lakeside bar.Hook, line, and sinker — you don’t want to miss this one!Ready to go catchin’ with one of Louisiana’s best captains? Visit www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com to check availability or book your trip today!

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff get bit by catfish in Southern Oklahoma with YouTuber Nate Williams of Adrenaline Rush Adventures while using the most primitive fishing tactic - hand fishing. Learn from the Chickasaw Nation about the history of this method that has been used by Native Americans for thousands of years.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: The Cast

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: The Southards continue their family tradition on Table Rock Lake. While they’re there, Trenton spends a day with “Mr. Worldwide” James Watson and learns some things from one of the best anglers on the lake.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The collaboration story between Winchester and Browning to create the groundbreaking 6.8 Western is featured. Tag along on a mule deer hunt in Utah with Chris Keefer and Winchester’s Jason Gilbertson, then follow Casey Keefer to Colorado for elk and Nebraska for whitetail where the 6.8 Western is put to the test.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The story of the game changing 350 Legend cartridge is documented at deer camps across the midwest with the Keefer Brothers in Kansas, Mark and Terry Drury in Missouri, Melissa Bachman in Nebraska and Team Winchester back in Missouri.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nobody chases the waterfowl migration as hard as Shawn Stahl of Team Winchester. The Michigan native spends over half of his year running the highways and flyways searching for the x. In this episode, we’ll tag along with Shawn and his crew with their Winchester pumps in hand as they hunker down hiding in fields and timber in hopes of locked wings from ducks and geese.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Huckberry's flagship adventure series is back in Japan and the DIRT crew is hungry as ever for adventure. This time, they’re diving into the Kansai region—where millennia-old traditions flow from the shore of Lake Biwa to surf breaks on the coast. Chef Coleman Griffin gives them a taste of the deep cultural immersion that inspires his culinary practice, from chef knives descended from samurai swords to fermented carp that went on to spawn sushi. And turns out, the perfect meal does exist, and the crew knew it as soon as they had a bite of their final omakase.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Guadalajara’s heritage runs deep. On the DIRT crew’s latest adventure, they explored the region’s rich history from volcanic highlands to secret surf coves. Chefs Xrysw Ruelas and Óscar Segundo sent Josh and co. to load up on locally grown coffee, spearfish between catching waves, and follow freshly harvested agave on its journey to becoming tequila. After learning the ropes of Mexico’s national sport, Charreria, and hitting up a Lucha Libre match, all the local flavors came together in a feast backed by thousands of years of tradition. There really is something special in the soil here.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: We researched all we could about fly fishing for grouper. Nothing came up. Normally a deep water fish, in Ozello Florida you can find gags in just a few feet of water, hiding in cracks waiting to ambush anything that swims overhead. Watch and see what we discovered. #fishingwithjay

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: Brandon "Eazy" Thompson is more than our local barber, he's an avid angler, hunter, and dedicated outdoorsman. He'd never fly-fished.....we decided to change that. #fishingwithjay

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: Over the past eight years, Mr. Trash Wheel and his fellow “trash interceptors” have gobbled up over 2,300 tons of trash in the Baltimore Harbor. We’ll be staying at Wildwood Resort, hitting the water with Captain Matt Loetscher of Living The Dream Guide Service, and capping off the day with spectacular lake views from their breezy lakeside bar.Hook, line, and sinker — you don’t want to miss this one!Ready to go catchin’ with one of Louisiana’s best captains? Visit www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com to check availability or book your trip today!
